citeinfo.title: Kakaramea_transects_intersect_20220719_192718 - Digital Shoreline Analysis System Version 5.0.20200527.0200 Intersect Feature Class

descript.purpose: a This dataset consists of point data which are created by the Digital Shoreline Analysis System version 5 (DSAS v5) at the intersection of shoreline and transect locations. The point data contain identification information related to the DSAS transect (TransectID, TransOrder) as well as the shoreline (ShorelineID, Uncertainty). Original measurement transects are cast by DSAS from the baseline to intersect shoreline vectors, and the intersect data provide location and time information used to calculate rates of change.

idinfo.useconst: These data were automatically generated using the DSAS version 5 software applications and should only be used for purposes explicitly stated by the originating organization.

dataqual.logic: These data were generated using DSAS, an automated software program which does not perform checks for fidelity of the input features. Any testing on these data should be carried out by end-users to ensure fidelity of relationships.
dataqual.complete: This dataset contains all the shoreline/transect intersects automatically generated by the Rate Calculation tool in the DSAS version 5 software application.

procstep.procdesc: Transect features generated using DSAS v5.0.20200527.0200. Parameters Used: baseline layer=Kakaramea_baseline, baseline group field=NULL, transect spacing=10 meters, search distance=600 meters, land direction=right, shoreline intersection=seaward, File produced = Kakaramea_transects .For additional details on these parameters, please see the DSAS help file distributed with the DSAS software, or visit the USGS website at: https://woodshole.er.usgs.gov/project-pages/DSAS/

Shoreline intersects and rate calculations performed. Parameters Used: shoreline layer=Kakaramea_shorelines, shoreline date field=DSASDate, shoreline uncertainty field name=UNCY, the default accuracy=4.4 meters, shoreline intersection=seaward, stats calculations=[SCE, NSM, EPR, LRR, WLR], shoreline threshold=2, confidence interval=95.5%. Files produced = Kakaramea_transects_intersect_20220719_192718 , Kakaramea_transects_rates_20220719_192718 .

enttyp.enttypd: The intersection points are generated by DSAS at each DSAS generated transect, where it crosses a shoreline.
enttyp.enttypds: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: The object identification field is automatically created and maintained by ArcGIS. It establishes a unique ID for each row in the attribute table.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The geometry field (shape) is automatically created and maintained by ArcGIS. It provides a definition of the feature type (point, line, polygon).
The TransectID relates directly to the original transect file "Object Identifier", "ObjectID" or "OID"

Assigned by DSAS on the basis of transect order along the baseline or baselines. If the user manually adds transects to the file in an edit session, they will be added to the end of the transect attribute table and given a new TransID (ObjectID). However TransOrder will be updated to reflect the position of the new transect with respect to the other transect along the baseline. As such this field provides the user with a method to sort transect attribute data from the start of the baseline segment with an ID=1 and increment sequentially alongshore to the end of the final baseline segment.

Values in this field correlate to the baseline attribute field "ID" and are assigned by DSAS to identify the baseline segment used to generate the measurement transect. Baseline segments assigned an ID = 0 are ignored by DSAS and no transects will be cast along those line segments.
The date (mm/dd/yyyy) of the shoreline intersected by the transect and represented (for shoreline analysis) by the intersect point.
The distance in meters between the DSAS reference baseline and the shoreline intersection point along a DSAS transect.
The X coordinate location of the intersect point.
The Y coordinate location of the intersect point.
The positional uncertainty of the shoreline at the intersect point, as defined by the shoreline positional uncertainty value (DSAS_uncy) of the shoreline (ShorelineID).
The distance in meters along the transect from the baseline to the intersect point, with the proxy-datum bias applied.
The estimated unidirectional horizontal offset between the MHW elevation of the lidar data and the HWL shoreline position.
The X coordinate location of the intersect point with the bias applied.
The Y coordinate location of the intersect point with the bias applied.
The uncertainty in the position of the HWL associated with the calculated proxy-datum bias value.
